doc.after: In addition to agriculture, slave labor was increasingly used in mining, shipbuilding and other industries.[84] The execution of Gabriel Prosser in 1800, Nat Turner's slave rebellion in 1831 and John Brown's Raid on Harpers Ferry in 1859 marked the growing social discontent over slavery and its role in the plantation economy. By 1860, almost half a million people, roughly 31% of the total population of Virginia, were enslaved.[85][86] This division contributed to the start of the American Civil War.
